title: Hamilton wins in Russia to end Ferrari's run of success
text:
Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton celebrates by kissing the trophy on the podium after winning the race REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov

SOCHI, Russia (Reuters) - Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton won the Russian Grand Prix in a Mercedes one-two on Sunday to end resurgent Ferrari’s run of success and stretch his lead to 73 points with five races remaining.

Hamilton’s closest rival and team mate Valtteri Bottas took second place, with Hamilton also banking an extra point for the fastest lap.

Ferrari’s Charles Leclerc finished third after an early team orders controversy with Sebastian Vettel, whose retirement on the 28th of 53 laps brought out a safety car that cemented Hamilton’s lead.

Ferrari had won the previous three races but Mercedes retained their unbeaten record in Russia dating back to the first race in Sochi in 2014. The victory was the 82nd of Hamilton’s career and ninth of the season.
